ground_truth: An arrangement of fresh-cut roses in a vase against a white tile wall is seen. Instantly, the tile is sprayed with blood, matching the deep crimson of the roses. Ricky comes down the stairs, followed by Jane. Ricky opens the door from the dining room, then stops as Jane appears behind him. A pool of blood is forming on the kitchen table. Ricky enters the kitchen and slowly approaches Lester's lifeless body, wide-eyed but not afraid. He kneels, gazing at Lester's unseen face, and Lester looks back; his eyes are lifeless, but he's smiling a slight smile. Then he smiles, ever so slightly. We're flying across a white blanket of clouds, and eleven-year-old Lester looks up, pointing excitedly as a dot of light falls across an unbelievably starry sky. Ricky and Jane lie curled up on Jane's bed, fully clothed, looking at each other, alarmed. Maple trees in autumn send ghostly leaves fluttering slowly toward pavement. Angela stands in front of the mirror fixing her make-up, but then turns, frightened. Close-up on an ancient woman's papery hands as they button a cardigan sweater. Carolyn walks slowly toward the red door, drenched to the bone, clutching her purse tightly, while a 1970 Pontiac Firebird is in the driveway of a suburban home and the sun's reflection is in the windshield. The Colonel enters, wet and wearing latex gloves, with blood covering the front of his T-shirt. He paces in front of a gun case with the glass door open, and a gun is conspicuously missing from inside. Jane opens her bedroom door, staring at us, while a door opens to reveal four-year-old Jane dressed in a Princess costume, holding a lit sparkler and smiling shyly. Carolyn enters, terrified and still clutching her purse, shuts the door, locks it, then takes out a Glock 19. She opens the closet door, shoves the gun into a hamper, and, aware of Lester's scent, grabs as many of his clothes as she can, burying her face in them. She sinks to her knees, pulling several clothing items down with her, and begins to cry. In black and white, a younger Carolyn sits across from us on a spinning teacup ride, laughing uncontrollably as she twists the wheel, making us spin faster. We're watching the video Ricky showed Jane earlier of an empty white plastic bag being blown about, the wind carrying it in a circle around us, sometimes whipping it violently, or sending it soaring skyward, then letting it float gracefully to the ground.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: An arrangement of fresh-cut blossoms in a container against a white tile barrier is observed. Instantly, the tile is sprayed with gore, matching the deep crimson of the blossoms. Ricky descends the steps, followed by Jane. Ricky opens the portal from the dining chamber, then pauses as Jane materializes behind him. A pool of gore is forming on the kitchenette table. Ricky enters the kitchenette and slowly approaches Lester's lifeless form, wide-eyed but not afraid. He kneels, gazing at Lester's unseen visage, and Lester looks back; his eyes are lifeless, but he's smiling a slight grin. Then he grins, ever so slightly. We're soaring across a white blanket of clouds, and eleven-year-old Lester looks up, pointing excitedly as a speck of light falls across an unbelievably starry night. Ricky and Jane recline curled up on Jane's bed, fully clothed, looking at each other, alarmed. Maple trees in fall send ghostly foliage fluttering slowly toward pavement. Angela stands in front of the mirror fixing her cosmetics, but then turns, frightened. Close-up on an ancient woman's papery hands as they button a cardigan sweater. Carolyn walks slowly toward the red portal, drenched to the bone, clutching her handbag tightly, while a 1970 Pontiac Firebird is in the driveway of a suburban dwelling and the sun's reflection is in the windshield. The Colonel enters, wet and wearing latex gloves, with gore covering the front of his T-shirt. He paces in front of a firearm case with the glass door open, and a firearm is conspicuously absent from inside. Jane opens her bedroom door, staring at us, while a door opens to reveal four-year-old Jane dressed in a Princess costume, holding a lit sparkler and smiling shyly. Carolyn enters, terrified and still clutching her handbag, shuts the door, locks it, then takes out a Glock 19. She opens the closet door, shoves the firearm into a hamper, and, aware of Lester's scent, grabs as many of his garments as she can, burying her face in them. She sinks to her knees, pulling several apparel items down with her, and begins to sob. In black and white, a younger Carolyn sits across from us on a spinning teacup ride, laughing uncontrollably as she twists the wheel, making us rotate faster. We're observing the video Ricky showed Jane earlier of an empty white plastic sack being blown about, the breeze carrying it in a circle around us, sometimes whipping it violently, or sending it soaring skyward, then letting it drift gracefully to the ground.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: A vase containing an arrangement of fresh-cut roses is seen against a white tile wall. Instantly, blood sprays across the tile, matching the deep crimson of the roses. The stairs are descended by Ricky, followed by Jane. The door from the dining room is opened by Ricky, then he stops as Jane appears behind him. On the kitchen table, a pool of blood is formed. The kitchen is entered by Ricky, who slowly approaches Lester's lifeless body, his eyes wide but not afraid. He kneels, gazing at Lester's unseen face, and Lester looks back; Lester's eyes are lifeless, but a slight smile is on his face. Then a slight smile crosses his face. Across a white blanket of clouds, we are flown, and eleven-year-old Lester points excitedly up at a dot of light falling across an unbelievably starry sky. Ricky and Jane lie curled up on Jane's bed, fully clothed, their expressions alarmed as they look at each other. Ghostly leaves are sent fluttering slowly toward the pavement by maple trees in autumn. Angela is fixing her make-up in front of the mirror, but then she turns, frightened. A close-up shows an ancient woman's papery hands buttoning a cardigan sweater. Carolyn walks slowly toward the red door, drenched to the bone, clutching her purse tightly, while a 1970 Pontiac Firebird is parked in the driveway of a suburban home and the windshield reflects the sun. The Colonel enters, wet and wearing latex gloves, with blood covering the front of his T-shirt. He paces in front of a gun case, its glass door open, and a gun conspicuously missing from inside. Jane opens her bedroom door, staring at us, while a door opens to show four-year-old Jane dressed in a Princess costume, holding a lit sparkler and smiling shyly. Terrified, Carolyn enters, still clutching her purse, shuts the door, locks it, then takes out a Glock 19. The closet door is opened by her, and she shoves the gun into a hamper, then, aware of Lester's scent, she grabs as many of his clothes as she can, burying her face in them. She sinks to her knees, pulling several clothing items down with her, and begins to cry. In black and white, a younger Carolyn sits across from us on a spinning teacup ride, twisting the wheel and laughing uncontrollably, making us spin faster. The video that Ricky showed Jane earlier is being watched by us, showing an empty white plastic bag being blown about, the wind carrying it in a circle around us, sometimes whipping it violently, or sending it soaring skyward, then letting it float gracefully to the ground.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: A vase with fresh roses stands against a white tile wall, suddenly sprayed with blood matching the roses' deep crimson. Ricky descends the stairs with Jane, stops at the dining room door as Jane joins him. A blood pool forms on the kitchen table. Ricky enters, approaches Lester's body without fear, kneels, and gazes at Lester, who has a slight smile despite lifeless eyes. An eleven-year-old Lester points excitedly at a light dot crossing a starry sky. Ricky and Jane lie on her bed, alarmed. Autumn maple leaves drift slowly to the ground. Angela fixes her make-up, then turns frightened. An old woman's hands button a cardigan. Carolyn, drenched, clutches her purse near a 1970 Pontiac Firebird at a suburban home. The Colonel, wet and in latex gloves, paces before an open gun case with a missing weapon. Jane opens her bedroom door, revealing herself as a young girl in a Princess costume with a sparkler. Terrified, Carolyn clutches her purse, locks the door, retrieves a Glock 19, and hides it. She grabs Lesterâ€™s clothes, buries her face in them, and cries. In black and white, younger Carolyn laughs on a spinning teacup ride. We view Ricky's video of an empty plastic bag swirling in the wind, sometimes soaring, other times descending gracefully.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Fresh-cut roses in a vase against a white tile wall appear, then the tile is sprayed with blood matching the roses' crimson. Ricky descends the stairs, with Jane behind. He opens the dining room door and pauses as Jane appears. A pool of blood is on the kitchen table. Ricky approaches Lester's lifeless body, wide-eyed but unafraid, kneeling to meet Lester's vacant smile. Eleven-year-old Lester points at a light in a starry sky. Ricky and Jane lie on Jane's bed, alarmed. Autumn maple leaves fall. Angela adjusts her make-up, then turns scared. An elderly woman's hands button a cardigan. Carolyn walks toward a red door, drenched, clutching her purse; a 1970 Pontiac Firebird is in the driveway. The Colonel enters, wet, wearing latex gloves, blood on his T-shirt, pacing before a gun case with a missing gun. Jane opens her bedroom door. A door reveals four-year-old Jane in a Princess costume with a sparkler. Carolyn, terrified, enters, locks the door, and takes out a Glock 19. She hides the gun in a hamper, grabs Lester's clothes, buries her face in them, and cries. Younger Carolyn laughs uncontrollably on a spinning teacup ride. A video shows a white plastic bag blown about by the wind, sometimes soaring, sometimes gracefully falling.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: An exquisite arrangement of freshly cut, vibrant roses is displayed elegantly in a clear vase, set against the backdrop of a pristine white tile wall. Suddenly and without warning, the once-spotless tile is splattered with a spray of blood, its dark, deep crimson shade eerily mirroring that of the roses. At that moment, Ricky descends the staircase, with Jane following closely behind him. Ricky proceeds to open the door leading from the dining room but abruptly comes to a halt as Jane emerges behind him. On the kitchen table, a pool of blood begins to form ominously. Ricky cautiously steps into the kitchen and slowly makes his way toward Lester's lifeless body, his eyes wide with shock, yet he remains unexpectedly unafraid. He kneels down, gazing intently at Lester's unseen face, and Lester returns the gaze; his eyes are devoid of life, yet they bear a faint, almost imperceptible smile. In a moment of subtle change, his smile grows ever so slightly. We find ourselves soaring above a vast expanse of a white, cloud-strewn sky, and an eleven-year-old Lester excitedly looks up, pointing with delight as a solitary dot of light traverses an unimaginably star-filled sky. Meanwhile, Ricky and Jane lie curled up together on Jane's bed, fully clothed and facing each other, expressions of alarm etched on their faces. Outside, in the crisp autumn air, maple trees shed their leaves, sending them down in a ghostly, fluttering descent toward the pavement below. Angela stands in front of a mirror, meticulously adjusting her makeup, but a sudden turn reveals her frightened expression. We zoom in closely on the hands of an ancient woman, whose papery skin is visible as she buttons up a cardigan sweater with deliberate care. Carolyn, now drenched to the core, walks slowly toward the striking red door, clutching her purse with a tight grip, as a classic 1970 Pontiac Firebird rests in the driveway of a suburban home, the sun casting its reflective glow on the windshield. The Colonel makes his entrance, soaked with wetness and wearing latex gloves, the front of his T-shirt smeared with blood. He paces back and forth in front of a gun case, its glass door swung open, conspicuously missing a gun from inside. Jane, standing resolutely, opens her bedroom door and stares directly at us, while another door opens to reveal a four-year-old Jane, delightfully dressed as a princess, holding a lit sparkler and smiling with shy innocence. Carolyn enters the scene, terror gripping her as she holds her purse tightly, locking the door swiftly behind her, then retrieves a Glock 19. She opens the closet door, shoves the gun hastily into a hamper, and enveloped by Lester's distinct scent, gathers up as many of his clothing items as she can, pressing them to her face. Overcome with emotion, she collapses to her knees, pulling several items of clothing down with her, and begins to weep uncontrollably. In a nostalgic black-and-white scene, a younger Carolyn sits across from us on a whirling teacup ride, laughing with uninhibited joy as she spins the wheel, causing us to whirl around even faster. The scene shifts as we watch the video Ricky had shown Jane earlier: an empty white plastic bag being whimsically tossed about by the wind, carried in graceful circles around us, at times whipped with force, only to be sent soaring skyward, and then gently floating back down to the ground, carried by the invisible hands of the wind.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: An exquisite and breathtaking arrangement of freshly cut, vibrant roses is displayed with elegance and care in a perfectly clear glass vase, set against the backdrop of a pristine, immaculate white tile wall. Suddenly, and without any warning, the once-spotless, clean tile is splattered with a sudden spray of blood, its dark, deep crimson shade eerily mirroring and resembling that of the beautiful roses. At precisely that moment, Ricky begins his descent from the staircase, with Jane following closely behind him. Ricky proceeds to open the door leading from the dining room but abruptly comes to a halt as Jane emerges and stands directly behind him. On the kitchen table, a pool of blood ominously begins to form. Ricky cautiously steps into the kitchen, slowly making his way toward Lester's lifeless, unmoving body. His eyes are wide with shock, yet he remains unexpectedly unafraid and composed. He kneels down, gazing intently at Lester's unseen face, and Lester returns the gaze. His eyes are devoid of life, yet they bear a faint, almost imperceptible smile. In a moment of subtle change, his smile grows ever so slightly. We find ourselves soaring above a vast, expansive stretch of a white, cloud-strewn sky as an eleven-year-old Lester excitedly looks up, pointing with delight as a solitary dot of light traverses an unimaginably star-filled night sky. Meanwhile, Ricky and Jane lie curled up together on Jane's bed, fully clothed and facing each other, expressions of alarm clearly etched on their faces. Outside, in the crisp, cool autumn air, maple trees shed their leaves, sending them down in a ghostly, fluttering descent toward the pavement below. Angela stands in front of a mirror, meticulously adjusting her makeup, but a sudden turn reveals her frightened expression. We zoom in closely on the hands of an ancient woman, whose papery, delicate skin becomes visible as she buttons up a cardigan sweater with deliberate care. Carolyn, now drenched to the core, walks slowly toward the striking red door, clutching her purse with a tight grip, as a classic 1970 Pontiac Firebird rests in the driveway of a suburban home, the sun casting its reflective glow on the windshield. The Colonel makes his entrance, completely soaked with wetness and wearing latex gloves, while the front of his T-shirt is smeared with blood. He paces back and forth in front of a gun case, its glass door swung open, conspicuously missing a gun from inside. Jane, standing resolutely, opens her bedroom door and stares directly at us, while another door opens to reveal a four-year-old Jane, delightfully dressed as a princess, holding a lit sparkler and smiling with shy innocence. Carolyn enters the scene, terror gripping her as she holds her purse tightly, locking the door swiftly behind her, then retrieves a Glock 19. She opens the closet door, shoves the gun hastily into a hamper, and enveloped by Lester's distinct scent, gathers up as many of his clothing items as she can, pressing them to her face. Overcome with emotion, she collapses to her knees, pulling several items of clothing down with her, and begins to weep uncontrollably. In a nostalgic black-and-white scene, a younger Carolyn sits across from us on a whirling teacup ride, laughing with uninhibited joy as she spins the wheel, causing us to whirl around even faster. The scene shifts as we watch the video Ricky had shown Jane earlier: an empty white plastic bag being whimsically tossed about by the wind, carried in graceful circles around us, at times whipped with force, only to be sent soaring skyward, and then gently floating back down to the ground, carried by the invisible hands of the wind.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: An arrangement of vibrant, fresh-cut roses is carefully placed in a vase, standing out starkly against the pristine white tile wall, their deep crimson hues rich and captivating. Suddenly, in a shocking contrast, the white tiles are immediately sprayed with bright, red blood that eerily matches the intense color of the roses, creating a horrifying visual. In another moment, Ricky descends the staircase methodically, each step echoing slightly until his entire figure is revealed, and just behind him, Jane follows closely, her presence quiet but noticeable. As Ricky approaches the door leading from the dining room, he grips the handle and pulls it open with a deliberate motion but hesitates in the doorway as Jane comes into view behind him, both pausing momentarily as if caught in the weight of the scene. Upon entering the kitchen, they are confronted with the grim sight of a pool of blood spreading ominously across the table's surface. Ricky, summoning a sense of determination and curiosity, steps into the kitchen with careful, slow strides until he is positioned near Lester's lifeless form, his eyes wide with a blend of shock and steely calmness, yet not a trace of fear in his demeanor. He lowers himself to one knee, leaning in to fix his gaze on Lester's unseen face, peering into eyes devoid of life, yet finding a subtle, haunting smile etched upon Lester's lips. This slight smile seems to mirror Rickyâ€™s, as he responds with a barely perceptible one of his own, as if sharing a silent understanding or final farewell. Abruptly, we are transported to an ethereal realm above a vast expanse of white, fluffy clouds, where a young eleven-year-old Lester gazes skyward, his eyes filled with wonder and excitement as he points eagerly to a tiny speck of light trailing across an intensely starry night sky, a moment filled with awe and innocence. Meanwhile, Ricky and Jane, now lying fully clothed on her bed, remain curled together, their eyes locked onto each otherâ€™s, expressions filled with a mix of surprise and concern. Outside, the autumn air stirs the branches of towering maple trees, their vibrant leaves slowly detaching and drifting ghost-like toward the pavement, a serene yet melancholic scene. Inside, Angela stands before her mirror, meticulously adjusting her make-up with a precise hand until a sudden jolt of fear makes her turn abruptly, startled and on edge. In another frame, the camera zooms in on the frail, delicate hands of an ancient woman as her fingers deftly work to button up her cardigan sweater, each movement deliberate and gentle. Meanwhile, drenched from head to toe by pouring rain and clutching her purse with a determined grip, Carolyn makes her way slowly toward a bold red door, her every step purposeful despite the soaking rain. In the driveway of a typical suburban home, a 1970 Pontiac Firebird sits parked, the gleaming sun reflecting sharply off its windshield, casting vivid, bright highlights. Within the house, the Colonel, also wet and wearing latex gloves, moves with restless energy, pacing in front of a gun case that sits ominously open, its glass door ajar, and a noticeable absence where a gun once lay, adding a layer of tension to his presence. Meanwhile, Jane opens her bedroom door, her gaze intent and directed outward as if confronting us directly, a silent challenge in her eyes. As this unfolds, another door opens to reveal a four-year-old Jane, endearingly dressed in a whimsical Princess costume, a lit sparkler in her hand casting a warm, flickering glow as she beams with a shy, innocent smile. The scene shifts back to Carolyn, who, still gripped by terror and clinging to her purse, enters a room, hastily shuts the door behind her, turns the lock securely into place, and retrieves a Glock 19 with a steady hand. She quickly opens the closet, thrusts the gun into a hamper with a decisive motion, and, overwhelmed by a rush of emotion as she senses Lesterâ€™s lingering presence through his scent, grabs a handful of his clothes, pressing them desperately to her face in a poignant embrace. Overcome by grief, she sinks to her knees, clothes cascading around her as she begins to sob, the weight of loss breaking through her composed exterior. In a stark black-and-white memory, a much younger Carolyn is seen seated across from us on a spinning teacup ride, her laughter uncontrollable and infectious as she spins the wheel with gusto, causing us to whirl around faster in a dizzying, joyful blur. Our attention then shifts to the simple yet mesmerizing video Ricky shared with Jane earlier, where an empty white plastic bag dances in the open air, the breeze catching it and sending it into a graceful, looping journey around us. At times, the bag is whipped about violently by sudden gusts, then lofted high into the sky, only to descend once more in an elegant, floating descent to the earth, its movements poetic and strangely beautiful.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: An arrangement of fresh-cut roses in a vase is seen against a white tile wall, which becomes sprayed with blood, mirroring the roses' deep crimson. Ricky descends the stairs with Jane following. He pauses at the dining room door as Jane appears behind him, noticing a pool of blood forming on the kitchen table. Entering the kitchen, Ricky approaches Lester's lifeless body, kneeling and meeting Lester's gaze, who looks back with lifeless eyes and a slight smile. The scene shifts to a sky full of stars, with an eleven-year-old Lester excitedly pointing at a falling light across the sky. Ricky and Jane lie alarmed on her bed, fully clothed, while outside, autumnal maple leaves flutter towards the pavement. Angela stands before a mirror, startled as she turns away. An aged woman's hands button a cardigan, followed by Carolyn, drenched and clutching her purse, approaching a red door. A 1970 Pontiac Firebird rests in the driveway, the sun reflecting off its windshield. The Colonel enters, also wet, wearing latex gloves with blood on his T-shirt, and paces before an open gun case missing a firearm. Jane opens her bedroom door to stare at us, transitioning to a glimpse of a four-year-old Jane in costume, holding a lit sparkler and smiling. Inside, Carolyn, terrified and clutching her purse, locks the door, retrieves a Glock 19 from her purse, and hides it in a closet hamper. Overcome by Lester's scent, she clutches his clothes, sinking to her knees and crying. In a black-and-white memory, a younger Carolyn laughs uncontrollably on a spinning teacup ride, twisting the wheel to spin faster. The scene concludes with the video Ricky showed Jane earlier, depicting an empty white plastic bag carried in circles by the wind, soaring and floating gracefully to the ground.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: An arrangement of fresh-cut roses in a vase against a white tile wall is seen, capturing the elegance often associated with romantic gestures or significant occasions. Instantly, the tile is sprayed with blood, a shocking contrast that matches the deep crimson of the roses, reminiscent of scenes from dramatic crime movies. Ricky comes down the stairs, his footsteps echoing in the quiet house, followed by Jane, whose worried expression hints at underlying tension. Ricky opens the door from the dining room, a room filled with cherished memories and family gatherings, then stops as Jane appears behind him. A pool of blood is forming on the kitchen table, a sight that evokes a chilling sense of loss and violence. Ricky enters the kitchen and slowly approaches Lester's lifeless body, wide-eyed but not afraid, as if confronting a long-feared inevitability. He kneels, gazing at Lester's unseen face, and Lester looks back; his eyes are lifeless, but he's smiling a slight smile, suggesting a final, mysterious resolution. Then he smiles, ever so slightly. We're flying across a white blanket of clouds, a scene evoking dreams or distant memories, and eleven-year-old Lester looks up, pointing excitedly as a dot of light, likely a meteor or falling star, falls across an unbelievably starry sky. Ricky and Jane lie curled up on Jane's bed, fully clothed, looking at each other, alarmed, as if they've just been jolted by a shared realization or discovery. Maple trees in autumn, with their vibrant leaves signaling the change of seasons, send ghostly leaves fluttering slowly toward pavement, creating an atmosphere of quiet reflection. Angela stands in front of the mirror fixing her make-up, preparing perhaps for an important event or encounter, but then turns, frightened by an unexpected sound or thought. Close-up on an ancient woman's papery hands, marked by time and experience, as they button a cardigan sweater, a routine task filled with nostalgia. Carolyn walks slowly toward the red door, which symbolizes both danger and passion, drenched to the bone, clutching her purse tightly, while a 1970 Pontiac Firebird, an iconic muscle car representing freedom and rebellion, is in the driveway of a suburban home and the sun's reflection is in the windshield, creating a blinding glare. The Colonel enters, wet and wearing latex gloves, with blood covering the front of his T-shirt, a grim hint at violent actions taken. He paces in front of a gun case with the glass door open, and a gun is conspicuously missing from inside, suggesting a mystery or impending danger. Jane opens her bedroom door, staring at us, as if challenging or questioning our presence, while a door opens to reveal four-year-old Jane dressed in a Princess costume, holding a lit sparkler that casts a warm glow and smiling shyly, capturing the innocence of childhood. Carolyn enters, terrified and still clutching her purse, shuts the door, locks it, then takes out a Glock 19, a popular model known for its reliability and used by both law enforcement and civilians for protection. She opens the closet door, shoves the gun into a hamper, and, aware of Lester's scent that lingers in his clothes, grabs as many of his clothes as she can, burying her face in them, overwhelmed by grief. She sinks to her knees, pulling several clothing items down with her, and begins to cry, her sobs echoing in the empty space. In black and white, a younger Carolyn sits across from us on a spinning teacup ride at a renowned amusement park, laughing uncontrollably as she twists the wheel, making us spin faster, a moment of carefree joy frozen in time. We're watching the video Ricky showed Jane earlier of an empty white plastic bag being blown about, reminiscent of the delicate dance of life and the random beauty found in everyday moments, the wind carrying it in a circle around us, sometimes whipping it violently, or sending it soaring skyward, then letting it float gracefully to the ground.

Angela stands in front of the mirror fixing her makeup but then turns frightened. Closeup on an ancient woman's papery hands as they button a cardigan sweater. Carolyn walks slowly toward the red door drenched to the bone clutching her purse tightly while a 1970 Pontiac Firebird is in the driveway of a suburban home and the sun's reflection is in the windshield. The Colonel enters wet and wearing latex gloves with blood covering the front of his Tshirt. He paces in front of a gun case with the glass door open and a gun is conspicuously missing from inside. Jane opens her bedroom door staring at us while a door opens to reveal fouryearold Jane dressed in a Princess costume holding a lit sparkler and smiling shyly. Carolyn enters terrified and still clutching her purse shuts the door locks it then takes out a Glock 19. She opens the closet door shoves the gun into a hamper and aware of Lester's scent grabs as many of his clothes as she can burying her face in them. She sinks to her knees pulling several clothing items down with her and begins to cry. In black and white a younger Carolyn sits across from us on a spinning teacup ride laughing uncontrollably as she twists the wheel making us spin faster. We are watching the video Ricky showed Jane earlier of an empty white plastic bag being blown about the wind carrying it in a circle around us sometimes whipping it violently or sending it soaring skyward then letting it float gracefully to the ground.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: An arrangement of fresh-cut roses in a vase against a white tile wall is seen. Instantly, the tile is sprayed with blood, matching the deep crimson of the roses. A dog comes down the stairs, followed by a squirrel. The dog opens the door from the dining room, then stops as the squirrel appears behind it. A pool of blood is forming on the kitchen table. The dog enters the kitchen and slowly approaches Lester's lifeless body, wide-eyed but not afraid. It kneels, gazing at Lester's unseen face, and Lester looks back; his eyes are lifeless, but he's smiling a slight smile. Then he smiles, ever so slightly. We're flying across a white blanket of clouds, and eleven-year-old Cheryl looks up, pointing excitedly as a dot of light falls across an unbelievably starry sky. The dog and the squirrel lie curled up on the squirrel's bed, fully clothed, looking at each other, alarmed. Maple trees in autumn send ghostly leaves fluttering slowly toward pavement. A giraffe stands in front of the mirror fixing its make-up, but then turns, frightened. Close-up on an ancient robot's papery hands as they button a cardigan sweater. An elephant walks slowly toward the red door, drenched to the bone, clutching its purse tightly, while a 1970 Pontiac Firebird is in the driveway of a suburban home and the sun's reflection is in the windshield. A frog enters, wet and wearing latex gloves, with blood covering the front of its T-shirt. It paces in front of a gun case with the glass door open, and a gun is conspicuously missing from inside. A rabbit opens her bedroom door, staring at us, while a door opens to reveal four-year-old Tina dressed in a Princess costume, holding a lit sparkler and smiling shyly. An elephant enters, terrified and still clutching its purse, shuts the door, locks it, then takes out a Glock 19. It opens the closet door, shoves the gun into a hamper, and, aware of Lester's scent, grabs as many of his clothes as it can, burying its face in them. It sinks to its knees, pulling several clothing items down with it, and begins to cry. In black and white, a younger lion sits across from us on a spinning teacup ride, laughing uncontrollably as it twists the wheel, making us spin faster. We're watching the video a cat showed a mouse earlier of an empty white plastic bag being blown about, the wind carrying it in a circle around us, sometimes whipping it violently, or sending it soaring skyward, then letting it float gracefully to the ground.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: An arrangement of fresh-cut daisies in a jug against a blue brick wall is seen. Instantly, the brick is sprayed with paint, matching the deep azure of the daisies. Ricky comes down the ladder, followed by Jane. Ricky opens the window from the living room, then stops as Jane appears behind him. A puddle of ink is forming on the dining table. Ricky enters the dining room and slowly approaches Lester's motionless figure, wide-eyed but not afraid. He kneels, gazing at Lester's unseen face, and Lester looks back; his eyes are vacant, but he's smiling a faint smile. Then he smiles, ever so slightly. We're flying across a fluffy blanket of snow, and eleven-year-old Lester looks up, pointing excitedly as a speck of dust falls across an unbelievably clear sunset. Ricky and Jane lie curled up on Jane's sofa, fully clothed, looking at each other, alarmed. Birch trees in winter send ghostly leaves fluttering slowly toward cobblestones. Angela stands in front of the window fixing her hair, but then turns, frightened. Close-up on a young woman's delicate hands as they button a leather jacket. Carolyn walks slowly toward the yellow gate, drenched to the bone, clutching her bag tightly, while a 1985 Jeep Cherokee is in the driveway of a rural home and the moon's reflection is in the side mirror. The Colonel enters, wet and wearing wool gloves, with paint covering the front of his jacket. He paces in front of a shelf with the wooden door open, and a notebook is conspicuously missing from inside. Jane opens her bedroom window, staring at us, while a window opens to reveal four-year-old Jane dressed in a Pirate costume, holding a lit candle and smiling shyly. Carolyn enters, terrified and still clutching her bag, shuts the window, locks it, then takes out a water pistol. She opens the cupboard door, shoves the water pistol into a basket, and, aware of Lester's scent, grabs as many of his books as she can, burying her face in them. She sinks to her knees, pulling several books down with her, and begins to cry. In black and white, a younger Carolyn sits across from us on a bouncing carousel ride, laughing uncontrollably as she twists the wheel, making us spin faster. We're watching the video Ricky showed Jane earlier of an empty red balloon being blown about, the wind carrying it in a circle around us, sometimes whipping it violently, or sending it soaring skyward, then letting it float gracefully to the ground.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: An arrangement of fresh-cut roses in a vase against a white tile wall is admired. Instantly, the tile is splattered with paint, matching the deep crimson of the roses. Ricky glides down the stairs, followed by Jane. Ricky slides the door from the dining room, then pauses as Jane appears behind him. A pool of ink is settling on the kitchen table. Ricky strolls into the kitchen and casually approaches Lester's lifeless body, wide-eyed but not startled. He crouches, gazing at Lester's unseen face, and Lester stares back; his eyes are vacant, but he's smiling a slight smile. Then he chuckles, ever so slightly. We're floating across a white blanket of clouds, and eleven-year-old Lester looks up, pointing eagerly as a dot of light dances across an unbelievably starry sky. Ricky and Jane sit curled up on Jane's bed, fully clothed, looking at each other, surprised. Maple trees in autumn release ghostly leaves gliding slowly toward pavement. Angela stands in front of the mirror adjusting her hair, but then spins, startled. Close-up on an ancient woman's papery hands as they fasten a cardigan sweater. Carolyn ambles slowly toward the red door, dripping to the bone, clutching her purse tightly, while a 1970 Pontiac Firebird is in the driveway of a suburban home and the sun's reflection is in the windshield. The Colonel arrives, drenched and wearing latex gloves, with paint covering the front of his T-shirt. He strides in front of a gun case with the glass door ajar, and a gun is conspicuously absent from inside. Jane peeks through her bedroom door, staring at us, while a door swings open to reveal four-year-old Jane dressed in a Princess costume, holding a lit sparkler and smiling bashfully. Carolyn steps in, petrified and still clutching her purse, shuts the door, bolts it, then takes out a Glock 19. She opens the closet door, hides the gun in a hamper, and, aware of Lester's scent, seizes as many of his clothes as she can, burying her face in them. She collapses to her knees, pulling several clothing items down with her, and begins to weep. In black and white, a younger Carolyn sits across from us on a spinning teacup ride, giggling uncontrollably as she rotates the wheel, making us spin faster. We're observing the video Ricky showed Jane earlier of an empty white plastic bag being tossed about, the wind carrying it in a circle around us, sometimes gusting it fiercely, or sending it gliding skyward, then letting it drift gracefully to the ground.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: An arrangement of fresh-cut cucumbers in a mug against a blue towel wall is seen. Instantly, the towel is sprayed with ink, matching the deep navy of the cucumbers. A piano comes down the escalator, followed by a lamp. A piano opens the window from the ballroom, then stops as a lamp appears behind it. A puddle of ink is forming on the gym chair. A piano enters the gym and slowly approaches a quilt's lifeless corner, wide-eyed but not afraid. It kneels, gazing at the quilt's unseen stitch, and the quilt looks back; its eyes are lifeless, but it's smiling a slight smile. Then it smiles, ever so slightly. We're flying across a blue scarf of mist, and eleven-year-old quilt looks up, pointing excitedly as a dot of paint falls across an unbelievably cloudy horizon. A piano and a lamp lie curled up on a lamp's mattress, fully clothed, looking at each other, alarmed. Willow trees in winter send ghostly petals fluttering slowly toward gravel. A chair stands in front of the window adjusting her glasses, but then turns, frightened. Close-up on a youthful man's metallic feet as they lace a hiking boot. A trumpet walks slowly toward the green gate, drenched to the bone, clutching its umbrella tightly, while a 1990 Mazda Miata is in the driveway of a rural barn and the moon's reflection is in the rearview mirror. The violin enters, wet and wearing velvet boots, with ink covering the front of its jacket. It paces in front of a bookcase with the glass drawer open, and a book is conspicuously missing from inside. A lamp opens her wardrobe drawer, staring at us, while a drawer opens to reveal four-year-old lamp dressed in a Pirate costume, holding a lit lantern and smiling shyly. A trumpet enters, terrified and still clutching its umbrella, shuts the window, locks it, then takes out a Nokia 3310. It opens the cupboard door, shoves the phone into a basket, and, aware of a quilt's scent, grabs as much of its fabric as it can, burying its face in them. It sinks to its knees, pulling several threads down with it, and begins to sob. In black and white, a younger trumpet sits across from us on a spinning Ferris wheel ride, laughing uncontrollably as it twists the lever, making us whirl faster. We're watching the video a piano showed a lamp earlier of an empty blue glass bottle being blown about, the wind carrying it in a spiral around us, sometimes whipping it violently, or sending it soaring skyward, then letting it float gracefully to the earth.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: An array of fresh-cut tulips in a vase against a beige brick wall is observed. Suddenly, the brick is splattered with ink, matching the deep violet of the tulips. Max springs up the ladder, followed by Sarah. Max closes the gate from the living room, then halts as Sarah emerges beside him. A puddle of ink is spreading on the kitchen counter. Max steps into the kitchen and hurriedly confronts Oliver's motionless figure, wide-eyed but not startled. He squats, peering at Oliver's unseen profile, and Oliver peers back; his eyes are motionless, yet he's grinning a slight grin. Then he grins, ever so faintly. We're gliding across a black sea of hills, and twelve-year-old Oliver glances down, pointing eagerly as a streak of shadow dances across a wildly illuminated city. Max and Sarah sit curled up on Sarah's couch, fully dressed, glancing at each other, startled. Pine trees in summer send eerie needles drifting rapidly toward dirt. Emily stands beside the window adjusting her scarf, but then spins, startled. Close-up on an elderly man's leathery fingers as they fasten a coat jacket. Brenda strides quickly toward the blue gate, soaked to the skin, holding her backpack loosely, while a 1968 Chevrolet Camaro is in the garage of a rural cabin and the moon's glow is in the side mirror. The Major exits, dry and wearing cotton mittens, with ink staining the front of his sweater. He strides behind a bookcase with the wooden panel open, and a volume is conspicuously absent from within. Sarah shuts her bedroom window, glaring at us, while a window slides open to reveal five-year-old Sarah dressed in a Warrior costume, holding a glowing lantern and grinning nervously. Brenda rushes in, panicked and still holding her backpack, slams the window, bolts it, then retrieves a Smith & Wesson Model 10. She pulls open the dresser drawer, tosses the weapon into a basket, and, conscious of Oliver's aroma, seizes as many of his belongings as she can, pressing her face into them. She collapses to her feet, pulling several belongings down alongside her, and begins to weep. In sepia, a teenaged Brenda stands beside us on a turning merry-go-round, giggling hysterically as she adjusts the lever, making us twist faster. We're observing the video Max played for Sarah earlier of a vacant blue plastic bottle being spun around, the breeze tugging it in a circle about us, occasionally tossing it fiercely, or lifting it gently skyward, then allowing it to drift softly to the earth.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: An arrangement of freshly shelled walnuts in a bowl against a black chalkboard wall is seen. Instantly, the chalkboard is smeared with paint, matching the deep indigo of the walnuts. Ricky comes down the escalator, followed by Jane. Ricky closes the window from the living room, then pauses as Jane dances behind him. A patch of ink is forming on the hallway carpet. Ricky enters the garage and quickly approaches Lester's unmoving shadow, wide-eyed but not startled. He crouches, peering at Lester's concealed face, and Lester gazes back; his eyes are vacant, but he's grinning a slight grin. Then he grins, ever so slightly. We're gliding over a green forest of pines, and eleven-year-old Lester peers up, gesturing excitedly as a speck of dust drifts across an amazing stormy horizon. Ricky and Jane lie sprawled on Jane's couch, fully clothed, staring at each other, surprised. Birch trees in spring send playful seeds drifting slowly toward sand. Angela stands in front of the window adjusting her scarf, but then spins, startled. Close-up on an ancient man's leathery hands as they fasten a leather jacket. Carolyn walks quickly toward the blue gate, soaked to the core, clutching her umbrella tightly, while a 1970 Plymouth Barracuda is in the carport of a rural house and the moon's reflection is in the side mirror. The Colonel arrives, dry and wearing wool gloves, with mud covering the back of his jacket. He strides in front of a trophy case with the wooden door ajar, and a trophy is conspicuously absent from inside. Jane closes her bedroom window, staring at us, while a window opens to reveal four-year-old Jane dressed in a Captain costume, holding a lit lantern and grinning shyly. Carolyn arrives, anxious and still clutching her umbrella, shuts the gate, bolts it, then takes out a pocket watch. She opens the pantry door, shoves the watch into a basket, and, aware of Lester's melody, grabs as many of his hats as she can, burying her face in them. She collapses to her knees, pulling several hats down with her, and starts to laugh. In sepia tone, a younger Carolyn sits across from us on a swaying swing ride, giggling uncontrollably as she turns the lever, making us rise higher. We're observing the movie Ricky played for Jane earlier of an empty blue balloon being tossed about, the breeze lifting it in a circle around us, sometimes yanking it fiercely, or sending it soaring upward, then allowing it to descend gently to the earth.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A cluster of artificial tulips in a bucket against a green metal fence is observed. Instantly, the fence is splashed with ink, matching the deep azure of the tulips. Danny climbs up the ladder, tailed by Sue. Danny shuts the gate to the garage, then pauses as Sue materializes beside him. A puddle of ink is collecting on the living room carpet. Danny steps into the living room and cautiously moves toward Jerry's inert statue, wide-eyed but not anxious. He sits, peering at Jerry's hidden visage, and Jerry glances back; his eyes are vacant, but he's grinning a faint grin. Then he grins, just subtly. We're gliding under a black curtain of smoke, and eight-year-old Jerry peers down, gesturing exuberantly as a speck of shadow drifts across an amazingly moonlit ocean. Danny and Sue rest sprawled out on Sue's couch, fully awake, staring at one another, startled. Pine trees in winter send eerie needles tumbling slowly toward gravel. Michelle stands behind the window adjusting her hat, but then spins, startled. Close-up on a young man's metallic fingers as they zip a leather jacket. Laura strides quickly toward the green gate, soaked to the core, gripping her backpack firmly, while a 1965 Chevy Impala is in the garage of a rural cabin and the moon's shimmer is in the windshield. The General enters, dry and wearing wool mittens, with ink covering the back of his coat. He prowls in front of a sword rack with the wooden door ajar, and a sword is conspicuously absent from within. Sue closes her closet door, glaring at us, while a cupboard opens to reveal five-year-old Sue clad in a Pirate outfit, waving a glowing lantern and grinning bashfully. Laura appears, anxious and still gripping her backpack, bolts the gate, secures it, then extracts a Nokia. She exposes the bureau drawer, drops the phone into a suitcase, and, aware of Jerry's fragrance, snatches as many of his shoes as she can, pressing her cheek into them. She collapses to her feet, dragging several footwear pieces down with her, and starts to laugh. In color, a senior Laura stands next to us on a spinning Ferris wheel seat, chuckling softly as she turns the lever, making us whirl slower. We're observing the film Danny played for Sue previously of an empty black rubber balloon getting tossed about, the breeze tugging it downward around us, sometimes jerking it gently, or sending it sailing earthward, then allowing it to settle elegantly to the soil.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: A vase of fresh-cut roses is suddenly sprayed with blood, matching their deep crimson color. Ricky descends the stairs, followed by Jane. He stops at a door as a pool of blood forms on the kitchen table. Ricky finds Lester's lifeless body and gazes at his face. Lester, with lifeless eyes, smiles slightly. We're transported to a sky of clouds where a young Lester points excitedly at the stars. Meanwhile, Ricky and Jane lie on a bed, alarmed. Angela is frightened as she fixes her makeup. Carolyn, drenched, approaches a red door, clutching her purse, as a 1970 Pontiac Firebird sits in the driveway. The Colonel, wet and wearing latex gloves, paces in front of an open gun case with a missing gun. Jane opens her bedroom door, recalling a memory of herself as a child in a Princess costume. Carolyn enters, terrified, locks the door, and takes out a Glock 19. She hides it in a hamper, overwhelmed by Lester's scent, and collapses while clutching his clothes, crying. In black and white, a younger Carolyn laughs on a spinning teacup ride. Ricky's video of a white plastic bag blowing in the wind plays, the bag dancing and soaring gracefully.

test_cases.name: Rotate Half Paragraph
test_cases.description: Angela stands in front of the mirror fixing her makeup but then turns frightened Closeup on an ancient woman's papery hands as they button a cardigan sweater Carolyn walks slowly toward the red door drenched to the bone clutching her purse tightly while a 1970 Pontiac Firebird is in the driveway of a suburban home and the sun's reflection is in the windshield The Colonel enters wet and wearing latex gloves with blood covering the front of his Tshirt He paces in front of a gun case with the glass door open and a gun is conspicuously missing from inside Jane opens her bedroom door staring at us while a door opens to reveal fouryearold Jane dressed in a Princess costume holding a lit sparkler and smiling shyly Carolyn enters terrified and still clutching her purse shuts the door locks it then takes out a Glock 19 She opens the closet door shoves the gun into a hamper and aware of Lester's scent grabs as many of his clothes as she can burying her face in them She sinks to her knees pulling several clothing items down with her and begins to cry In black and white a younger Carolyn sits across from us on a spinning teacup ride laughing uncontrollably as she twists the wheel making us spin faster We are watching the video Ricky showed Jane earlier of an empty white plastic bag being blown about the wind carrying it in a circle around us sometimes whipping it violently or sending it soaring skyward then letting it float gracefully to the ground An arrangement of freshcut roses in a vase against a white tile wall is seen Instantly the tile is sprayed with blood matching the deep crimson of the roses Ricky comes down the stairs followed by Jane Ricky opens the door from the dining room then stops as Jane appears behind him A pool of blood is forming on the kitchen table Ricky enters the kitchen and slowly approaches Lester's lifeless body wideeyed but not afraid He kneels gazing at Lester's unseen face and Lester looks back his eyes are lifeless but he is smiling a slight smile Then he smiles ever so slightly We are flying across a white blanket of clouds and elevenyearold Lester looks up pointing excitedly as a dot of light falls across an unbelievably starry sky Ricky and Jane lie curled up on Jane's bed fully clothed looking at each other alarmed Maple trees in autumn send ghostly leaves fluttering slowly toward pavement
